tr.th: Closing Information for The Mt. Olive School District

h1.strong: Remote instruction will continue until at least May 15

p.span: the Mount Olive Township School District
will continue home instruction according to our Health-Related Closure Plan until at least May 15. All athletics and activities are suspended until at least May 15 as well.

view the MOTSD Health-Related Closure Plan for daily updates from superintendent Dr. Robert Zywicki, as well as vital information about home instruction assignments, WiFi access, free and reduced-price meal pick-up, and continuity of district operations.

td.p:
The Entire District
will be Closed

Mount Olive High School
will be Closed

Mount Olive Middle School
will be Closed

Chester M. Stephens Elementary School
will be Closed

Mountain View Elementary School
will be Closed

Sandshore Elementary School
will be Closed

Tinc Road Elementary
will be Closed

a.h3: Latest COVID19 Updates for the Mount Olive School District
a.p: This is an external link; you will be brought to another website.

Mount Olive High School’s makerspace helped create more than 15,000 protective visors for use by medical personnel in New Jersey and New York. The first batch of 300 visors was delivered in early April to Hackettstown Regional Medical Center, Saint... read more»

a.h3: MOHS named a top US high school
a.p: Mount Olive High School was recently named one of the best high schools in the country by U.S. News and World Report, completing a hat trick of prestigious honors received by the school district this spring. MOHS ranked in the... read more»

Stay up to date with current district and school news by following us on Twitter: District – @MountOliveTSD Superintendent Rob Zywicki – @ZywickiR Mount Olive High School – @PrincipalMOHS Mount Olive Middle School – @mtolivemiddle Chester M. Stephens Elementary School – @CMSmtolive... read more»
This is an external link; you will be brought to another website.

div.h2: Mt. Olive School District video library
div.p:
See for yourself what we’re all about!
New videos being added all the time!

"There's a reason why my mother moved our family to the town she grew up in. Her alma mater, Mount Olive High School, was and still is one of the best high schools in the state and country. If it weren't for the supportive art teachers and resources available to me, I would never have been encouraged or had the confidence to follow my dream as an artist. As a professional multimedia designer and producer, I can say there are lessons and skills that I gained at MOHS that did not just put me ahead in my college years, but have stayed with me throughout my career. If I could go back and do it all again, I wouldn't change a thing."
Jessica Van Zee – Class of 2013

"There's a reason why my mother moved our family to the town she grew up in. Her alma mater, Mount Olive High School, was and still is one of the best high schools in the state and country. If it weren't for the supportive art teachers and resources available to me, I would never have been encouraged or had the confidence to follow my dream as an artist. As a professional multimedia designer and producer, I can say there are lessons and skills that I gained at MOHS that did not just put me ahead in my college years, but have stayed with me throughout my career. If I could go back and do it all again, I wouldn't change a thing."
Jessica Van Zee – Class of 2013

"I am amazed at how efficiently and diligently school administrators, teachers, and support staff work to make every day the best day for all students. As a parent, I could not be prouder of the excellent education my two boys (Class of 2015 and Class of 2019) have received."
Vranda Kamath – Parent

"I was already a fairly accomplished educator when I left my former school 12 years ago to come to Mount Olive High School, but I was looking for a place that could help me take my game to the next level. MOHS has done just that. I get to work closely every day with dedicated teachers who have incredible ideas that they are eager to share. Administrators encourage me to take risks in order to really help my students connect math with the real world. I truly feel emboldened to be my best self thanks to the forward-thinking, supportive school culture that exists here at MOHS."
James West – Teacher

"Throughout my high school experience, my teachers have shown me how to approach learning with a genuine passion and a childlike curiosity. MOHS has molded me to become a lifelong learner and provided abundant opportunities for growth. I'm grateful to say these treasured experiences have equipped me well for my future."
Emilia Folkerts – Class of 2019

"The Mount Olive School District has provided me with the opportunity to realize my passion, education through the arts, and to help students not only develop an appreciation of art but also to see its value in life. I've watched my students blossom into well-rounded adults and along the way have formed lifelong relationships with colleagues, parents, students, and stakeholders. I'm privileged to work with a dedicated staff that arrives early and leaves late, ensuring that each student receives a quality education."
Diane Phares – Teacher

"Fourteen years ago we moved to Mount Olive solely because of the great reputation of the school system. It's the best decision we've made for our children. At all levels, their teachers have challenged them and encouraged them, laying a foundation of learning that will benefit them the rest of their lives."
Shruti Lake – Parent

"Mount Olive High School has allowed me to reach all of my goals as a student, an athlete, and a leader. Without the support from the school and staff members, my aspirations in student government would never have been fulfilled."
Benet Tilves – Class of 2020

"While the facilities and course offerings at Mount Olive High School are state of the art, the people here are what truly make MOHS so special. I feel lucky to be in a district that emphasizes collaboration and to work with so many impressive and enthusiastic educators. Setting aside time for collaboration allows us to continually examine and refine our practices in order to provide the very best to our students. In turn, students are excited to learn, create, and grow."
Melissa Pawlyk – Teacher

"Mount Olive High School provided a supportive environment that allowed me to explore my curiosities and build upon my passion for business, and prepared me to tackle a challenging college course load. The MOHS curriculum and the high expectations of teachers set me up for success and my upcoming transition to a technology consulting job."
Erica Anderson – Class of 2016

address.p: The Mount Olive Township School District, a guiding and unifying partner in a dynamic community, educates, challenges and inspires all learners within a safe, nurturing environment to discover and develop their unique abilities as literate, ethical and contributing citizens of the world.
